Alright, so what does the custom partitioner show? (Also to be noted, are you dual-booting? If so, I wound up having ot defrag and CHKDSK Windows before it let me install Ubuntu)
Okay, so you want to click on the ext4 and set the "mount point" as "/" (root)
IT's already formatted as ext4 which is *perfect*. All you've got to do now is set the mount point as "/" (a slash)
Whatever the default is should be fine.
Just double-check everything. Your ext4 partition should have a mount point of "/", the size of the partitions are measured in MB, and your swap should of course be mount point os "swap area"
Alright
You said you had /dev/sda6(swap). So, remember how you set your ext4 to mount point of "/"?  Just do the same thing for your swap but say "use as: swap area".
